title: Harry Bates, Modernist Architect of Long Island Homes, Dies at 95
description: Withstanding “a tsunami of shingles” on houses going up on the East End, he stuck to an aesthetic of clean, elegant lines and simple materials.
dc:creator: Fred A. Bernstein
media:description: Harry Bates in 1988 inside a home under construction in Water Mill, N.Y., on Long Island. Designed by his firm at the time, Bates & Booher, it incorporated wooden beams from an old barn.
